main.p-1-1: STUCKDISCOUNT was founded in Berlin in 2009. At first only stucco was sold and the assembly work was done by different companies. One of the fitters was an engineer and draftsman, today's entrepreneur and managing director, Ali Kanber Aygün. When the founder was looking for a successor due to age, he decided - due to many positive reviews from customers - to pass the company on to him. Today - since 2012 - the company STUCKDISCOUNT has been operated under his management in Berlin as a medium-sized family business, which is guild-certified.
main.p-1-2: Due to our high level of qualification, we attach great importance to good and detailed planning before the implementation of our projects in order to achieve an optimal cost-benefit result for our customers. We would be happy to advise you. Please arrange an appointment with us.
main.title-2: A little journey through the age of stucco
main.p-2-1: Stucco is a term that is known to almost everyone and yet not very much is known about its origin. Stucco has existed since the Neolithic Age and has been used since 7000 BC. to decorate interiors and exteriors. According to history, its origin lies in the city of Catalhöyük (present-day Türkiye). In ancient times, plaster and alabaster were also used for the floor. The Egyptians used the material to immortalize Nefertiti in the form of a bust. But the Greeks also found an interesting way to use stucco, and that was to pour it on their dead. The Romans also used stucco to store fruit and to make wine.
main.p-2-2: In Germany people have been working with stucco since 1473. Palaces and church ceilings in particular were decorated with stucco, which is why pompous stucco designs often come to mind when one thinks of the Renaissance. The baroque period turned out to be the key time for striving for a master plasterer title. Stucco was and is an extremely valuable form of decoration and was considered a luxurious part of style.
main.p-2-3: However, with the beginning of modernism, stucco elements became a thorn in the side of architecture. The term stucco removal was introduced for the first time because stucco was systematically removed from the old buildings, damaging numerous historical objects. Today, the stucco elements are, as they were for most of history, a very noble and indispensable part of interior and exterior furnishings. Stucco is versatile and adapts to a wide variety of styles and completes the overall picture of any facility. It is therefore an honor for us as a plastering company to ensure that an architectural tool like this can continue its history.

card-1.title: wholesale and retail
card-1.content: We sell stucco elements made of plaster of the highest quality (natural material alabaster model plaster) from international production and our own production in our workshop in Neukölln, carefully handcrafted.

card-2.title: Individual production
card-2.content: We can also realize your most individual wishes in terms of pattern and structure and much more. Let our experts advise you personally without obligation.

card-3.title: The stucco work
card-3.content: We assemble our stucco with the utmost care and according to your individual wishes in apartments, houses and commercial properties up to new hotel buildings, as well as in the renovation of old and new buildings.

card-4.title: impression technique
card-4.content: We have experience in restoring incomplete stucco elements. We copy and reproduce the existing stucco parts by hand and can thus easily replace the missing parts and close existing gaps.

context.p-0: Here are a few examples of our work. All photos were taken at jobs sites which we have been working at recently. These will give you an impression of the diverse applications of stucco – from classic to modern.

We import internationally and factory-direct. Therefore, large quantities are absolutely no problem, as we always keep larger quantities in stock. Besides supplying retailers, processors and industry users, we’re also very happy to serve individual homeowners!

context.p-1: Even small quantities can be ordered from us or picked up in person in our  store during regular business hours. We’re happy to pass our price advantage on to you and also give you a comprehensive consultation. Visit us in Berlin (Neukölln)!

context.p-0: STUCK DISCOUNT has its headquarters in Berlin and is personally run by its owner Ali K. Aygün. The company specializes in wholesale and retail of fine limestone and marble plaster (without synthetic additives) and stucco of the highest quality (natural alabaster stucco material) including professional installation. We offer our customers stucco work which includes comprehensive services and also provides value-adding home improvements.

AdditionalСontent.p-0: Comprehensive services from a one-stop-shop – an “All-Inclusive-Package”, covering all areas.

AdditionalСontent.p-1: We offer detailed planning and consultation in advance, in other words, we are happy to visit you on-site and take digital measurements right there. Our draftsman and engineers use these dimensions in our office to create a CAD – drawing for you on the computer for a preliminary view of the project as well as for direct construction preparation.

AdditionalСontent.p-2: Please contact us for an interesting selection from our extensive range of finest stucco elements from international manufacturers as well as in-house production – carefully crafted in our Neukölln workshop and offering the best possible quality (eg. crown moldings, reliefs etc.)

AdditionalСontent.p-3: Custom manufacturing, tailored to the requirements at your work site for indoor & outdoor use. Thanks to our restoration and molding techniques, we are able to create 100% accurate copies of existing stucco elements and thus are easily able to close gaps in existing crown molding and let what was old shine in new splendor. This way, the original beauty and craftsmanship of the classic builders from past centuries can be reconstructed and preserved for future generations. Likewise, we also have experience in the production of curves, arcs and elliptical shapes (eg. segmental arches, etc.) in order to produce them according to your measurements.

AdditionalСontent.p-4: Professional installation by our own and experienced staff complement the range of services provided to you and guarantees successful completion of the project.

AdditionalСontent.p-5: Delicate trompe l’oeil, provided by our specialist painter, gives you the option of adding the ultimate personal touch to your new stucco room and wall improvements, for example by adding three-dimensionality where there is actually none.

context.p-0: Moulding and reproduction: We can either take the moulding from the original at your location or we take the original stucco element back to our workshop. It is then carefully prepared in order to provide an optimum result later. At this point, professional experience is required because it takes craftsmanship to create the stucco element desired by the customer from natural gypsum material. An in-depth examination of the nature of the model is essential for the moulding process to work perfectly and the subsurface must be assessed very thoroughly. After carefully preparing the original, we put it in a specially made wooden frame. Then we pour the silicone into the frame, immediately after mixing. After hardening (which normally takes about 24 hours), the silicone mold can be removed from the model and prepared for the casting of the reproduction. It can now be used to create any number of copies. This way, any required shape can be copied.

context.p-1: We look forward to your order!

info.consultation: Arrange a non-binding and free consultation with our experts. We are happy to hear from them!
info.contactWithUs: You can reach us personally Monday to Friday from 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. and Saturday from 9:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. - or simply use the contact form for a short message and we will get back to you as soon as possible.
